> "What the body does to the drug"

| Symbol | Description |
| :----: | :---------- |
| $\D$ | Dose |
| $\ii$ | Dosing interval (interdose interval) |
| $\CL$ | Clearance |
| $\Vd$ | Volume of distribution |
| $\ke$ | Elimination rate constant |
| $\ka$ | Absorption rate constant |
| $\F$ | Bioavailability |
| $R_0$ | Infusion rate |
| $T_\text{inf}$ | Duration of infusion |
| $\Cpl$ | Plasma concentration |

: Pharmacokinetic symbols {#tbl-pk-symbols tbl-colwidths="[20, 80]"}

## Intravenous bolus

### Single dose

Initial concentration @eq-c0-iv.

$$
\C_0=\frac{\D}{\Vd}
$$ {#eq-c0-iv}

Plasma concentration @eq-c-single-iv-dose-1cmt.

$$
\C(t) = \C_0 \times e^{-\ke \times t}
$$ {#eq-c-single-iv-dose-1cmt}

### Multiple doses

$$
\C_n(t) =
  \frac{\D}{\Vd}
  \times
  \frac{
    \left(1 - e^{-n \times \ke \times \ii}\right)
  }{
    \left(1 - e^{-\ke \times \ii}\right)
  }
  \times
  e^{-\ke \times t}
$$

at peak: $t = 0$; at steady state $\mathrm{n} \rightarrow \infty$; at trough: $t = \ii$

$$
\C_\text{max, ss} =
  \frac{\D}{\V}
  \times
  \frac{1}{\left(1 - e^{-\ke \ii} \right)}
$$ {#eq-cmaxss-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt}

$$
\C_\text{min, ss} = \C_\text{max, ss} \times e^{-\ke \times \ii}
$$ {#eq-cminss-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt}

Plasma concentration @eq-c-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt.

$$
\C(t) = \Cmax \times e^{-\ke \times t}
$$ {#eq-c-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt}

Peak @eq-cmax-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt.

$$
\Cmax =
  \frac{
    \C_0
  }{
    1 - e^{-\ke \times \ii}
  }
$$ {#eq-cmax-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt}

Trough @eq-cmin-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt.

$$
\Cmin = \Cmax \times e^{-\ke \times \ii}
$$ {#eq-cmin-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt}

Average concentration (steady state) @eq-cavgss-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt.

$$
\bar{\C}_\text{pl, ss} = \frac{\D}{\CL \times \ii}
$$ {#eq-cavgss-multiple-iv-dose-1cmt}

## Oral administration

### Single dose

Plasma concentration @eq-c-single-po-dose-1cmt.

$$
\C =
  \frac{
    \F \times \D \times \ka
  }{
    \Vd \left(\ka - \ke \right)
  }
  \times
  \left(
    e^{-\ke \times t} - e^{-\ka \times t}
  \right)
$$ {#eq-c-single-po-dose-1cmt}

Time of maximum concentration @eq-tmax-single-po-dose-1cmt.

$$
t_\text{max} =
  \frac{
    \ln \left(\ka / \ke \right)
  }{
    \ka - \ke
  }
$$ {#eq-tmax-single-po-dose-1cmt}

### Multiple doses

Plasma concentration @eq-c-multiple-po-dose-1cmt.

$$
\C =
\frac{
  \F \times \D \times \ka
}{
  \Vd (\ka - \ke)
}
\times
\left(
  \frac{
    e^{-\ke \times t}
  }{
    1 - e^{-\ke \times \ii}
  }
  -
  \frac{
    e^{-\ka \times t}
  }{
    1 - e^{-\ka \times \ii}
  }
\right)
$$ {#eq-c-multiple-po-dose-1cmt}

Time of maximum concentration @eq-tmax-multiple-po-dose-1cmt.

$$
t_\text{max} =
  \frac{
    \ln
      \left(
        \frac{
          \ka \times \left(1 - e^{-\ke \times \ii} \right)
        }{
          \ke \times \left(1 - e^{-\ka \times \ii} \right)
        }
      \right)
  }{
    \left(k_{\mathrm{a}}-k_{\mathrm{e}}\right)
  }
$$ {#eq-tmax-multiple-po-dose-1cmt}

Average concentration (steady state) @eq-cavgss-multiple-po-dose-1cmt.

$$
\bar{\C} =
  \frac{
    \F \times \D
  }{
    \CL \times \ii
  }
$$ {#eq-cavgss-multiple-po-dose-1cmt}

### Clearance

$$
\CL = \frac{\D \times \F}{\AUC}
$$

$$
\CL = \ke \times \Vd
$$

## Constant rate infusion

### Plasma concentration (during infusion)

$$
\mathrm{C}=\frac{R_0}{\CL} \times\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-k_{\mathrm{e}} \times t}\right)
$$

### Plasma concentration (steady state)

$$
\C = \frac{R_0}{\CL}
$$

### Calculated clearance (Chiou equation)

$$
\CL =
  \frac{2 \times R_0}{\left(C_1 + C_2 \right)} +
  \frac{
    2 \times \Vd \times \left(C_1 - C_2 \right)
  }{
    \left(C_1 + C_2\right) \times \left(t_2 - t_1\right)
  }
$$

## Short-term infusion

### Single infusion

Since $\ii = t$ for $\Cmax$

$$
\Cmax = \frac{D}{\V \ke T} \times \left(1 -e ^{-\ke T} \right)
$$

$$
\Cmin = \Cmax \times e^{-\ke \times (\ii - T)}
$$

Peak

$$
\C_{\max (1)} =
  \frac{\D}{\CL \times T}
  \times
  \left(1 - e^{-\ke \times T} \right)
$$

Trough

$$
\mathrm{C}_{\min (1)}=\mathrm{C}_{\max (1)} \times \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{e}}(\ii-\mathrm{T})}
$$

### Multiple infusions

Peak

$$
\Cmax =
  \frac{\mathrm{D}}{\CL \times \mathrm{~T}} \times \frac{\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{e}} \times \mathrm{~T}}\right)}{\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{e}} \times \ii}\right)}
$$

Trough

$$
\Cmin =
  \mathrm{C}_{\text {max }} \times \mathrm{e}^{-\mathbf{k}_{\mathrm{c}} \times(\ii-\mathrm{T})}
$$


#### For multiple short-term I.V. infusion at steady state

$$
C_{\max }=\frac{D}{V \ke T} \times \frac{\left(1-e^{-\ke T}\right)}{\left(1-e^{-\ke \ii}\right)}
$$

$$
C_{\min }=C_{\max } \times e^{-\ke(\ii-T)}
$$

### Calculated elimination rate constant

$$
\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{e}}=\frac{\ln \left(\frac{\mathrm{C_max}^*}{\mathrm{C_min}^*}\right)}{\Delta \mathrm{t}}
$$

with C^\*^~max~ = measured peak and C^\*^min = measured trough, measured over the time interval $\Delta$t

### Calculated peak

$$
\mathrm{C_max}=\frac{\mathrm{C_max}^*}{\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{e}} \mathrm{t}^*}}
$$

with C^\*^~max~ = measured peak, measured at time t^\*^ after the end of the infusion

### Calculated trough

$$
\mathrm{C_min}^*=\mathrm{C_min}^* \times \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{e}} \times t^*}
$$

with C^\*^min = measured trough, measured at time t^\*^ before the start of the next infusion

### Calculated volume of distribution

$$
\Vd =
  \frac{\D}{\ke \times T}
  \times
  \frac{
    \left(1 - e^{-\ke \times T}\right)
  }{
    \left[C_{\max }-\left(C_{\min } \times e^{-\ke \times T}\right)\right]
  }
$$

### Calculated recommended dosing interval

$$
\ii =
  \frac{
    \ln \left(\frac{\mathrm{C}_{\text {max(desired })}}{\mathrm{C}_{\min (\text { desired })}}\right)}{\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{e}}}+\mathrm{T}
$$

### Calculated recommended dose

$$
\D =
  \C_{\max (\text{desired})} \times \ke \times \V \times T \times
  \frac{
    \left(1 - e^{-\ke \ii}\right)
  }{
    \left(1 - e^{-\ke \times T} \right)
  }
$$

## Two-Compartment-Body Model

$$
\C = \mathrm{a} \times e^{-\alpha t} + \mathrm{b} \times e^{-\rho t}
$$

$$
\AUC_{\infty} = \mathrm{a} / \alpha+\mathrm{b} / \beta
$$

$$
\Vd_{\text {area }} > \Vd_{\mathrm{ss}} > \V_c
$$

Vd_area = V beta?

## Ideal Body Weight

### Male

IBW = 50 kg + 2.3 kg for each inch over 5ft in height

### Female

IBW = 45.5 kg + 2.3 kg for each inch over 5ft in height

### Obese

ABW = IBW + 0.4*(TBW-IBW)

## For One Compartment Body Model

### If the dosing involves a I.V. infusion (more equations)

$$
\begin{aligned}
& C_t =
  \frac{\D}{\V \times \ke \times T}
  \times
  \left(e^{\ke T} - 1 \right)
  \times
  e^{-\ke t}
  \quad
  \text{(most general eq.)}
&& \text{during infusion t = T so,} \\
\\
& C_t =
  \frac{\D}{\V \ke T}
  \times
  \left(1 - e^{-\ke t} \right)
  \quad
  \text{(during infusion)}
&& \text{at steady state } t \rightarrow \infty, e^{-\ke t}, \mathrm{t} \rightarrow 0 \text{ so,} \\
\\
& \Cplss =
  \frac{\D}{\V \ke T} =
    \frac{k_0}{\V \ke} =
      \frac{k_0}{\CL}
  \text{(steady state)}
  \quad
&& \text{ remembering }
  k_0 =
  \frac{\D}{T}
  \text{ and } \CL = \V \times \ke
\end{aligned}
$$

# Dosage regimens

Dose rate = Dose / tau

$\mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{ss}}=\mathrm{R}_0 / \CL$
( $\mathrm{R}_0=$ rate of infusion $)$
$\mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{inf}}=\mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{ss}} \times\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{kt}}\right)$
(1-compartment)
$\quad \mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{ss}, \mathrm{av}}=\mathrm{F} \times$ Dose $/(\CL \times \ii)$
(variation of eq. 24)
$\mathrm{R}_{\mathrm{ac}}($ accumulation index $)=1 /\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{k} \ii}\right)$
(1-compartment)
$\mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{ss}, \max }=\mathrm{F} \times$ Dose $\times \mathrm{R}_{\mathrm{ac}} / \mathrm{V}$
(1-compartment)
$\quad C_{s s, \min }=C_{s s, \text { max }} \times e^{-k \times \ii}$
(1-compartment, combination of eq. 22 and 28)
Maximum $\ii=\ln \left(\mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{ss}, \max } / \mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{ss}, \min }\right) / \mathrm{k}$
(1-compartment, variation of eq. 23)
Corresponding dose $\times \mathrm{F}=\mathrm{V} \times\left(\mathrm{C}_{\text {max,ss }}-\mathrm{C}_{\text {min,ss }}\right)$ (1-compartment)

# Exposure (AUC)

1. $\AUC_{\mathrm{iv}}=\mathrm{C}_{(0)} / \mathrm{k}$
(1-compartment)
2. $\AUC_{\mathrm{iv}}=\mathrm{C}_1 / \lambda_1+\mathrm{C}_2 / \lambda_2$
(2-compartment)
3. $\AUC=\Sigma($ trapezoids $)+\mathrm{C}_{\text {last }} / \lambda_{\text {last }}$
(Always applicable)
